column4: howdy!  I'd like to know, how do we add getty tty* on Ubuntu?  we don't use /etc/inittab because of upstrat, so what would be the correct place to add them?
have a look in /etc/event.d. you can just copy the tty files that already exist.
did that.  still no tty where I expect it :(
you don't have a /etc/event.d/tty1 and friends?
yes, but copying one of those, calling it tty9 and changing the content to tty9 didn't result in one extra tty coming up.
modify ACTIVE_CONSOLES in /etc/default/console-setup
so I'm wondering if new files in /etc/event.d need to be enabled somewhere else.
(else the other files won't be run)
and then relaunch which startup file?
or sorry, which init.d script?
if it's console-setup, that didn't enable the new tty either.
and I already defined tty as 1-9 there
it's not. reboot for a proper test.
can't that be activated live by restarting some script?
probably. i like to make sure my changes survive a reboot, as a sort of useful paranoia.
I'd like to test first, before rebooting.  just reloading all the tabs in Firefox takes about 30 minutes.  if there's any way I can avoid rebooting, I'd rather do that
do what you like :-)
hence why I'm asking how to tell upstrat to reload its event.d scripts
actually, try "initctl reload" see if that works.
also, for future reference: http://upstart.ubuntu.com
ah, good one.  thanks!
yep, no trouble
